titlePart.supplied: Statement on the Phoenix Planned Parenthood Clinic

sourceDesc.bibl: Planned Parenthood Group Defended by Mrs. Sanger. Unidentified newspaper. Sept. 10, 1959

doc.headNote: Sanger was interviewed at the Tuscon Planned Parenthood Clinic on the warning received by the Phoenix clinic that it was violating a law against distributing birth control literature.

head.title: Planned Parenthood Group Defended by Mrs. Sanger

docBody.p: "The Phoenix clinic has to get a good lawyer and show it is doing nothing illegal," Mrs. Sanger said here today.
Mrs. Sanger said, "We looked into that when we first started the clinic here (in 1935) and the only thing we could find that was illegal was to advertise publicly.

"We went to Phoenix then, went through that with the attorney general's office up there and that was what we found. We've always told the Phoenix people not to advertise and I don't believe they have. The first thing they've got to do is get a good lawyer and show they're doing nothing illegal."
Mrs. Sanger indicated she will throw her weight behind the Phoenix clinic in this fight. She said she would go to Phoenix, if necessary, after she ascertains the full extent of the problem.
